Data: Amir to Head, no run what a gem of a delivery! Fuller and hits the seam and nips away from the batsman late and Head has no clue about that as the ball misses the outside edge by a whisker. Head acknowledges it
Amir to Head, 1 run tucked to midwicket
Amir to Smith, FOUR runs beauty. Smith is batting on a different plane here. A fraction short and a little bit wide and Smith covers the off-stump before slapping it gloriously through point
Amir to Smith, no run covers the off-stump and lets this fullish ball that is angled across from over the wicket to the wicketkeeper
Amir to Smith, no run shuffles across and lets it go outside off
Amir to Smith, no run moves across to get on top of this short of a length ball and drops it in front of cover who comes charging in to pick it up. Loud call for no from Smith
Junaid to Head, no run tries to slap this short of a length ball from the fifth-stump channel into the off-side but gets an inside-edge and chops it
Junaid to Head, FOUR runs back of a length ball outside off, frees his arms to crunch a cut shot and there is no chance for the fielder at point as he has picked the gap perfectly
Junaid to Head, 2 runs comes forward to meet the pitch of this length ball and drills it through extra cover
Junaid to Head, no run good length ball on the fifth-stump channel and Head sticks his bat out. But that one really kicks up from the length area and beats the outside edge as Head sticks his bat out

Junaid to Head, FOUR runs powerful drive through the off-side. Fuller and outside off and Head leans into the drive as he gets it to the left of the fielder at short cover who is late to get down and the ball sneaks from underneath his hands
Junaid to Head, no run defended straight back to the bowler
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run pitched up outside off, Smith presses forward and crunches a drive but straight to cover
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run floated up and sliding in with the arm, Smith looks to flick it away and gets an inside edge to short fine leg
Imad Wasim to Head, no run fullish on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
Imad Wasim to Head, 1 run pitched up on leg stump channel, presses forward and eases it down to long-on
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run shifts back in the crease to this length ball and nudges it to midwicket
Imad Wasim to Head, 1 run pushed across on a fullish length to the left-hander, Head presses forward and pushes this through covers
Hasan Ali to Head, no run fuller ball, holding its line on off after being angled across from over the stumps, Head inside-edges the front foot push to the pads
Hasan Ali to Head, no run short of a length outside off, is pushed back and jumps up to ride the bounce and again does not find the middle of the bat as he chops the backfoot defence into the turf
Hasan Ali to Head, no run fuller ball on leg stump, drills a powerful on drive but straight to the fielder at mid-on

Hasan Ali to Head, 1 leg bye short of a length ball, angled across, tries to flick it away and does not make contact as the ball goes to the slip cordon after hitting the pad. They run the leg bye even as a stifled appeal is made for lbw but that pitched outside leg

Hasan Ali to Smith, no run tries to slap this short and wide ball but he walked across his stumps so ended up getting cramped for room. That one also bounced more than he anticipated, so he gets beaten
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run punched off the backfoot square of the wicket through the off-side
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run comes forward and eases this pitched up ball to long-on
Imad Wasim to Head, no run worked back to the bowler
Imad Wasim to Head, 1 run flighted ball on off, comes forward to meet the pitch and gets it wide of mid-off for a quick single
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run comes forward and defends to covers where the fielder makes a diving save to prevent the single
Imad Wasim to Head, no run comes forward and defends to covers where the fielder makes a diving save to prevent the single
Imad Wasim to Head, no run stays back to this short of a length ball and whips it back to the bowler
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run length ball, angling in on off, tucked between midwicket and mid-on
Hasan Ali to Head, no run fuller ball, pushed firmly to the left of mid-off who runs across and slides to stop it clean

Hasan Ali to Head, FOUR runs fuller ball outside off, around a set of stumps wide, and Head crunches a straight drive, lets it come on and times the straight drive as the ball comfortably beats mid-off running to his left
Hasan Ali to Head, no run predictable response from the bowler. Bangs one in short and angles away, Head arches back and gets his head out of the line of the ball

Hasan Ali to Head, 2 runs good running, tucks this ball off the backfoot through the vacant midwicket region and they have enough time to hare back for the second by the time square leg can run across and pick it up
Hasan Ali to Head, no run slower full ball outside off, drills it straight down the ground but this time the shot does not have enough power in it for the ball to beat the diving mid-off fielder
Hafeez to Smith, no run waits for it to come on before turning it away to square leg
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run gets his front leg across and dabs this pitched up ball through midwicket
Hafeez to Head, no run flat length ball, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
Hafeez to Head, no run backs away but the bowler follows him with a length ball. Tries to force it through the leg side but finds the inside edge
Hafeez to Head, no run pushed straight back to the bowler
Hafeez to Head, 1 run whipped off the backfoot down to long-on

Hasan Ali to Head, FOUR runs short ball, banged in but it is far too short and does not bounce enough to unsettle the batsman as Head swivels around with the pull and the ball goes to the deep midwicket boundary, beating the fielder running across from deep square leg

Hasan Ali to Head, OUT and the bowler has the last laugh. Hasan Ali celebrates with a jump and a pump of the fists. Follows up the short ball with a fuller delivery outside off, forcing Head to go after it and try to drive through covers. The batsman falls for the trap and gets a healthy edge for his troubles. Rizwan catches it without fuss behind the stumps
Hasan Ali to Maxwell, no run fullish length ball just outside off, Maxwell leaves it alone
Hasan Ali to Maxwell, no run angles it in on a length and Maxwell wears it on the pad as he misses the flick
Hasan Ali to Maxwell, no run short of a length, tailing back in late but Maxwell is sure of his off-stump and trusts the bounce on that one to lift his bat and let it go to the wicketkeeper

Hasan Ali to Maxwell, FOUR runs fuller ball outside off and that is a beautiful cover drive. Comes forward and crunches it through the off-side. Did not try to hit it too hard. Just leans forward, uses the pace of the bowler and caresses it
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run comes forward and pushes this pitched up ball to mid-on who comes up with a clumsy effort, gets half-down to his left and lets it go. Lazy effort
Hafeez to Maxwell, no run length ball, spinning in, tucked to square leg off the backfoot
Hafeez to Maxwell, no run comes down the track to take this on the full and nudges it to midwicket

Hafeez to Maxwell, 3 leg byes appeal for lbw but not given and the ball races away behind the stumps before it is pulled back before the ropes. Hafeez has decided to review this. Maxwell was coming charging down and misses it and looks to half-heartedly flick. Misses as the ball spins in, hits him on the pad and the ball evades the keeper as well. Replays show that the ball has struck
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run eased down to long-on off the backfoot
Hafeez to Maxwell, no run clipped straight to square leg. No run there
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run walks across to protect the off stump before leaving this full delivery in the channel outside off
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run walks across the stumps and defends it down the pitch, to the left of the bowler
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run defends this good length ball into the off side from the crease
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run shuffles across to this full ball and leaves it as it holds its line outside off
Hasan Ali to Smith, 2 runs short ball, shuffles across and swivels around with the pull to deep square leg. Deep midwicket runs to his right and picks it up
Hasan Ali to Smith, 2 runs shorter ball, pulls it, this time to cow corner and more work for the deep midwicket fielder
Hafeez to Maxwell, no run pitched up at a flatter trajectory, clipped to the left of square leg
Hafeez to Maxwell, FOUR runs there's the reverse sweep. Pitched up on middle and leg and Maxwell crunches it through backward point
Hafeez to Maxwell, no run flatter ball on the stumps, turned away to midwicket
Hafeez to Maxwell, no run comes down the track to meet the pitch of this flatter ball and pushes it wide of mid-on who makes a good stop

Hafeez to Maxwell, 1 run just short of the fielder at deep backward square leg. Short ball from Hafeez and Maxwell does not get hold of the pull shot. Does not keep it along the ground but luckily for him it falls in front of the fielder as he comes running in
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run fuller ball, clipped to deep midwicket
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run walks across to this length ball and bunts it down the pitch where mid-on fields it
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run short of a length ball, walks across and tries to flick it to the leg side but it bounces more than he anticipates and gets it off the top part of the bat into the off side
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run strides forward to this fuller ball and drives it to covers
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run good length, around a set of stumps outside off, walks across and defends it down the pitch
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run short of a length ball, tries to fetch a pull from outside off and gets an under-edge as the ball goes towards mid-on
Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run fullish length ball, works it to square leg and there is no one there. The bowler jogs across to field it and they think momentarily of the second but decide against it
Imad Wasim to Smith, 2 runs pitched up on the stumps, clipped away to deep square leg
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run loopy flighted ball that is angled in on middle and leg, Smith caresses it to the leg side
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run short of a length ball, makes room and punches off the backfoot down to long-off
Imad Wasim to Maxwell, no run flat short of a length ball that is pushed through quicker, nearly 100 kph, defended off the backfoot to the bowler
Imad Wasim to Maxwell, 1 run cut square of the wicket to deep point
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run flatter fullish length ball, comes forward and pushes it into covers

Hafeez to Maxwell, SIX runs shot. Springs down the track. The ball is flighted just enough for him to get right on top of that and loft it clean and powerfully over deep midwicket. Clears the boundary by a distance
Hafeez to Maxwell, 1 run length ball that pitches on leg, tucked to midwicket. Runs the first one hard but has to settle for one as the ball goes straight to the fielder
Hafeez to Smith, no run flatter ball, pushed through on middle and leg, clipped away to midwicket
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run short of a length and some width outside off, shuffles across and eases it down to long-on with an angled bat

Hafeez to Maxwell, 1 run tucked to the on side, just wide of midwicket and they think of the second run again. But Maxwell perhaps just stumbled for a moment there and deep square leg runs in and gathers it by then
Hafeez to Smith, no run good length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket. No run there
Imad Wasim to Maxwell, no run sliding in quicker on leg, at 96kph, dabbed to the leg side
Imad Wasim to Maxwell, 1 run shorter in length, shifts back and slaps it out to sweeper cover
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run good length ball, tucked to midwicket where there is a slight fumble by the fielder but no damage down
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 wide fired down the leg side, Smith cannot make contact on the attempted glance and the wicketkeeper collects it well as he anticipates early and moves to his left
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run steered to deep backward point with an open bat face
Imad Wasim to Maxwell, 1 run given air and pitched up on off, eased off the front foot to long-off and they jog the single
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run gets a good stride forward and defends this fullish length ball into the off side
Hafeez to Maxwell, 1 run pushed across on middle stump from around the wicket. Pushed off the front foot through extra cover
Hafeez to Smith, no run slightly short of a length, punched off the backfoot to the right of the bowler who gets down to his right and gets a hand to it
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run whips this back of a length ball off the backfoot to long-on
Hafeez to Maxwell, 1 run flatter and on a length, tucked away to square leg
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run length ball, knocks it out to deep midwicket
Hafeez to Maxwell, 1 run strides forward and meets the pitch of this fullish ball to push it into the covers area
Imad Wasim to Maxwell, no run quicker ball on middle, turned away to midwicket

Imad Wasim to Maxwell, OUT knocked him over. Quicker ball from Wsim and Maxwell charges down the track and the bat hits the pad as he tris to force it through the off-side. Does not make contact with the ball as a result and it goes through to take out the stumps
Imad Wasim to Wade, 1 run pushed across the left-hander quicket at 96.2kph. Forces Wade to come forward and go after it and he gets a thickish outside edge that goes away towards third man
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run back of a length and on the stumps, punched off the backfoot to the left of the bowler who runs across and fields it
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run tries to flick this fuller ball into the leg side but he is beaten by pace and the ball goes off the pad into the off side, towards the point region
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run ends a probing over with a good length ball that is defended back towards him off the front foot

Hafeez to Wade, 1 run flighted and sliding in on leg, tries to flick it away and that was a chance. It was in the air as it went to the right of the forward short leg fielder. Went quite quickly and he had little to no time to react to it. Very tough chance
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run fuller ball, presses forward and works it down to long-on
Hafeez to Wade, no run flighted, loopy delivery around off, pushed towards mid-on off the front foot
Hafeez to Wade, 1 run comes down the track to take this flatter ball on the full and whips it away wide of mid-on
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run flighted on off and middle, comes forward and gently pushes it to long-on

Hafeez to Wade, no run rapped on the pads and appeal for lbw. Turned down by the umpire. It was a length ball and angling in and Wade was shifting on the backfoot looking to flick it away. Hit on the pad but the angle seems to suggest it was missing leg
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run very full ball that is angled in at a flat trajectory, clipped away to deep square leg
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run optimistic appeal for caught behind but not given. Wade is done in by the drift that takes the ball away and gets beaten as he sticks his bat at it

Imad Wasim to Wade, no run another appeal for caught behind and this time given. But Australia have reviewed it. Wade was pretty quick in reviewing it. Pushed across to the left-hander and rushes him with pace. Wade is caught on neither foot and walks across after being opened up as he tries to stick his bat out. Replays show that there is no bat involved as confirmed by both HotSpot and
Imad Wasim to Wade, 1 run shorter and width outside off, punched off the backfoot through backward point
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run clipped behind square on the leg side and the wicketkeeper runs across and fields it
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run flatter short of a length ball, does not get up much, pushed cautiously off the front foot to covers
Hafeez to Wade, no run nudged to the on side
Hafeez to Wade, 1 run sees a little width outside off and slaps this square of the wicket
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run flighted and sliding in with the arm, turned away to midwicket
Hafeez to Wade, 1 run comes down the track and nudges it wide of mid-on
Hafeez to Smith, no run good length ball, punched off the backfoot towards midwicket
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run worked to deep midwicket
Imad Wasim to Smith, no run loopy tossed up ball, sliding in on leg with the arm, turned behind to short fine leg
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run gives it too much air and bowls a low full toss that is driven straight down the ground
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run comes forward to this fuller ball that is angled across from around the wicket and pushes it into covers
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run gets down low to sweep early and manages to put bat to ball but it is a tad straight and he cannot beat short fine leg
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run good length ball that is pushed across quicker and keeps low outside off, Wade shuffles across and bunts it off the backfoot
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run flat short of a length ball, punched off the backfoot back to the right of the bowler
Hafeez to Smith, no run flat and straight outside off, comes forward and defends back to the bowler
Hafeez to Smith, no run
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run fuller ball, works it to long-on
Hafeez to Wade, 1 run flighted outside off, mid-off lets it go and they take the single
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run tucked off the backfoot to deep midwicket
Hafeez to Wade, 1 wide pushed in to the left-hander but the drift takes it way down the leg side and Wade can't make contact on the tuck
Hafeez to Wade, 2 runs comes down the track and whips this with the angle through square leg
Amir to Smith, no run short of a length outside off, moves across and defends into the off side
Amir to Smith, no run
Amir to Smith, 1 run fuller ball, clipped away to deep midwicket
Amir to Wade, 1 run short of a length, angling in from outside off, lets it come on before opening the face of his bat to steer it to third man
Amir to Smith, 1 run good length, wide outside off, moves across and uses his wrists to tuck it to the leg side
Amir to Wade, 1 run fuller ball, driven straight to extra cover. The batsmen put pressure on the fielder and set off for the single and there is a misfield which takes the run out out of the equation
Hafeez to Wade, no run fuller and on the stumps, clipped straight to forward short leg
Hafeez to Wade, no run comes forward to this fuller ball and pushes it back to the bowler
Hafeez to Wade, FOUR runs comes down the track, it's a short of a length ball but he still has enough time to lay into a pull shot
Hafeez to Wade, no run comes down the track and pushes this into the off side
Hafeez to Wade, 1 run flighted on the stumps, driven off the front foot to long-off
Hafeez to Smith, no run fullish ball, pushes it to mid-on and walks down a step or two as he thinks of the single but the fielder makes a very good, diving stop and they don't take the run
Amir to Wade, 1 run short of a length outside off, slapped off the backfoot to square third man
Amir to Smith, 1 run shuffles across the stumps to this wider ball and dabs it with soft hands to third man
Amir to Wade, no run fuller ball, pushed to mid-off
Amir to Wade, no run walks across to the stumps and advances down early. Amir adjusts well and drops it short and Wade is forced to drop it with soft hands into the off side
Amir to Wade, FOUR runs gets an outside edge as he tries to slash at this short of a length ball and the ball goes away wide of the cordon quickly down to the third man boundary
Amir to Wade, no run left alone in the channel outside off
Hafeez to Smith, no run pitched up on the stumps, pushed off the front foot into the leg side
Hafeez to Smith, 1 run short of a length, not much turn, stays on the backfoot and turns this away to midwicket
Hafeez to Wade, no run loopy delivery, angling in with the arm on leg stump, blocked off the front foot to the bowler
Hafeez to Wade, 1 run gets down to sweep and the ball is a tad shorter so he guides it with a flat bat towards backward square leg
Hafeez to Smith, no run fuller and on the stumps, skews it off the splice on the front foot push to the bowler
Hafeez to Smith, no run short of a length, no turn again, whips it off the backfoot to midwicket
Hasan Ali to Wade, no run short of a length on the stumps, blocked off the backfoot back to the bowler
Hasan Ali to Wade, no run fuller ball outside off, pushed off the front foot into covers
Hasan Ali to Wade, no run length ball outside off, gets up more than he anticipates but he negotiates the bounce well and drops it with soft hands into the off side
Hasan Ali to Wade, 1 run short of a length, does not get the timing right as he swivels around and pulls to deep midwicket

Hasan Ali to Smith, 2 runs fuller ball outside off, clips it wide of deep midwicket and the deep square leg fielder had to cover some ground running to his left. They had the chance to take three, but settle down for two
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run fullish length ball outside off, gets a long way across and defends with bat close to pad back to the bowler
Malik to Wade, no run pitched up outside off, driven into the off side
Malik to Wade, no run some bounce and turn from the short of a length region around off, Wade is a bit taken aback and manages to drop it with soft hands into the off side
Malik to Wade, 1 run turns it away to square leg for a quick single
Malik to Smith, no run shifts back in the crease, not much turn from the length region and he turns it away to square leg
Malik to Smith, 1 run tucked behind square off the pads
Malik to Wade, no run punched off the backfoot to mid-off
Hasan Ali to Smith, no run walks across to meet this fuller ball outside off and drives it straight to mid-off

Hasan Ali to Smith, no run tries to play the pull shot against this back of a length ball but it gets slightly big on him and he is beaten by pace as it comes on a tad quicker so he skews it off the splice to mid-on

Hasan Ali to Smith, 1 run fuller ball on middle, clipped away to deep midwicket. And that's the fifty for Smith. He has had to grind it out for this fifty. But job only half-done as Australia need him to stay on
Hasan Ali to Wade, no run fuller ball outside off, drops it in front of points and walks a step or two forward looking for the single but cannot take it as it goes straight to the fielder

Hasan Ali to Wade, FOUR runs beautiful placement. Juicy half-volley that is fired straight on the stumps and Wade uses his wrists and uses them perfectly to get it wide of the bowler and at the same tim comfortably beat mid-on
Hasan Ali to Wade, no run fullish outside off, driven firmly straight to mid-off
Malik to Smith, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, clipped behind square
Malik to Wade, no run floated up outside off, tries to drill it hard and straight but cannot time it well
Malik to Wade, no run guides it to point but cannot find the gap. Smith is in a hurry looking for a single but has to go back
Malik to Wade, 1 run sliding in with the arm on leg stump, runs it to cover-point for a quick single
Malik to Smith, 1 run pushed across on a length outside off, waits for it in the crease and whips it off the backfoot to deep square leg
Malik to Wade, no run pitches on leg and straightens, Wade uses his wrists to guide it to the off side but cannot find the gap
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run good length on off, no turn, punched off the front foot to long-off
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run arm ball at 96.3, fired wide and flat and beats the attempted cut
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run tries to reverse sweep this flatter ball that is pushed across on off and does not make contact
Imad Wasim to Wade, no run slashes hard at this fullish ball that is angled across and gets beaten. Struggling for timing here
Imad Wasim to Wade, 1 run short and wide, slaps it away off the backfoot square of the wicket
Imad Wasim to Smith, 1 run walks into the shot as he comes down the track and pushes it to long-off
Malik to Smith, 1 run comes down the track and takes it on the full before whipping it away to deep midwicket
Malik to Wade, 2 runs shuffles back and across before whipping it away through midwicket. They call early for the second and charge back to complete it. Good running
Malik to Wade, no run comes forward to this length ball and steers it to point
Malik to Wade, 1 run comes down the track and gets leg side of it before he tucks this away to midwicket as it dips late
Malik to Smith, no run length ball on leg, turned away to midwicket
Malik to Smith, 1 run flashes hard but does not really get hold of it as he carves it over the covers region and the ball goes on the bounce to the man guarding the sweeper cover fence

Imad Wasim to Smith, 5 wide fired down the leg side, Smith gets down and tries to scoop it but the ball drifts down leg and he cannot make contact. The wicketkeeper also cannot get his hands to it as it is bowled at a poor line
Imad Wasim to Smith, 2 runs shorter ball, pulled hard to deep midwicket and long-on runs across and does well to slide in and cut it off

Imad Wasim to Smith, 2 runs comes down the track and pushes it past the bowler who dives to his right. A half-chance for the bowler but he cannot get his hands to it, probably didn't get down low enough. Long-on dives to his left in the deep and pulls it back

Imad Wasim to Smith, OUT good length ball that is delivered at a slower pace and Smith is through with the shot early. Gets an inside edge as he comes forward looking to force it through the off side and the ball crashes into the stumps. Done in by the lack of pace
Imad Wasim to Faulkner, 1 run fullish and on the pads, pushed to wide long-on
Imad Wasim to Wade, 1 run width on offer outside off, carves it square of the wicket from the crease
Imad Wasim to Faulkner, 1 leg bye down the leg side, tries to flick it but the ball brushes the pad and goes away behind the stumps
Malik to Faulkner, 1 run tries to flick from outside off and closes the bat face early. Gets a leading edge but because he went at it with soft hands, it goes along the ground towards mid-off
Malik to Wade, 1 run advances down the ground and nearly yorks himself but manages to push it down to long-on
Malik to Faulkner, 1 run tucked off the backfoot to deep midwicket. There are fielders at both deep midwicket and deep square leg and it will only be a single

Malik to Wade, OUT goes through the gate. Wade's troubled stay against spin comes to an end. Played all around it. Attacking line and on the stumps. Wade pushes forward awkwardly, leaves a big gap between bat and pad and the ball sneaks through that gap to take out middle stump
Malik to Starc, 1 run sliding in with the arm on leg stump line, gets an inside edge on the pad and the ball goes away to deep square leg
Malik to Faulkner, 1 run stays back and works it to midwicket. It was a length ball and kept slightly low but he manages to jam his bat down and make contact
Imad Wasim to Faulkner, 2 runs fuller and sliding in on leg with the arm, nicely places the tuck between deep midwicket and deep backward square leg
Imad Wasim to Faulkner, 1 run sort and wide, cut square of the wicket
Imad Wasim to Starc, no run short of a length ball, delivered at some pace, defended from the crease
Imad Wasim to Starc, 1 run fuller ball, eased down to long-on
Imad Wasim to Faulkner, no run flat and on a length, 101.6 kph, pushed into the off side off the front foot
Imad Wasim to Faulkner, no run fired quicker and straighter, on middle, pushed gently back to the bowler
Junaid to Starc, 1 run full and angling on leg, tries to clip it and gets an inside edge on the pad, stifled appeal for lbw. Got a little bit of reverse there
Junaid to Faulkner, no run short of a length and angling away, keeps lower than expected but Faulkner manages to keep it out to the off side
Junaid to Faulkner, 1 run fuller ball, angled across, holding its line outside off this time and it is crunched to mid-off

Junaid to Starc, OUT slower full ball and some good fielding by Junaid. He is having a dream comeback game. It was full and Starc was trying to clip it away but inside-edges it to the pad and the ball just rolls away. He looks for a non-existent single and it does not help that Faulkner is a tad unresponsive. Sent back late and Junaid picks it up and nails a direct hit

Junaid to Cummins, no run appeal for caught behind and not given. That really seemed out as there was a clear noise. HotSpot shows a clear mark and snicko also confirms the outside edge. It was short of good length and angling away. Cummins was trying to slap it away but there is not quite enough room and he skews it to the wicketkeeper. Pakistan does not have a review left
Junaid to Cummins, no run
Amir to Faulkner, no run slower ball, angled across outside off, tries to open his bat face and run it down to third man and does not make contact
Amir to Faulkner, FOUR runs back of a length on leg stump channel, jumps up and turns it behind square to the deep fine leg boundary
Amir to Faulkner, no run yorker outside off, dug out straight back to the bowler
Amir to Faulkner, 1 run fullish and angling across outside off, gets a good stride across and drops it in front of point with bat close to pad

Amir to Cummins, OUT short ball, tries to hook and gets a top-edge as the ball goes to the wicketkeeper. Probably got a glove again and it's a very feeble edge. This time, Cummins walks. Does not bother looking at the umpire as he walks away even as the wicketkeeper starts appealing
Amir to Hazlewood, no run fuller ball outside off, pushes at it without much feet and the bat turns in his hands slightly as the ball goes to point
Junaid to Faulkner, no run slower back of a length ball, tries to open the bat face and run it down and gets very narrowly beaten
Junaid to Faulkner, 1 wide short ball, well-directed, sways out of the line. But it is too short and called a wide

Junaid to Faulkner, 1 run fuller ball outside off, driven firmly to mid-off and he starts off with the single. Jogs initially before realising late that the ball goes to the fielder quite quickly and then ups his pace even as a throw is fired at the non-striker's end that does not hit the stumps
Junaid to Hazlewood, 1 leg bye tucked off the pads to the backward square leg region and it is vacant there so the wicketkeeper has to run across and gather it. Easy single
Junaid to Faulkner, no run short of a length, jumps up and drops it in front of point. Faulkner was off for the single but is sent back by Hazlewood and it's the right call in the end
Junaid to Faulkner, 1 run fullish ball, pushes it off the front of the toes towards mid-on
Junaid to Hazlewood, no run tries a yorker but ends up bowling a low full toss outside off that is driven firmly but straight to cover

Amir to Faulkner, FOUR runs unintentional boundary. It was a short ball and he was backing away. But the ball follows him and takes the top part of his bat before flying over wher ethe cordon would have been and into the third man boundary

Amir to Faulkner, OUT held at point and that's the end of the innings with four balls remaining. It was a short of good length ball but he is in no position to slap it. Skews it in the air to point where Shafiq settles under it easily

Excellent bowling effort from Pakistan. All credit to Junaid for setting the tone early with a superb opening spell. Credit to Mohammad Hafeez also for some good captaincy and field placements. He gave both Junaid and Amir an extended opening spell. Junaid only bowled in the high 120s for the most part but got the ball to swing prodigiously early. Once early wickets fell, it set up the platform

6.30pm Thanks Akshay. Pakistan may not get a better chance for a win in this series. They've bowled exceptionally well, couldn't have done too much better. On a slow surface, changes in pace will decide the speed of the game. Australia were forced to make their own pace, and struggled. Pakistan's strength has almost always been their bowling, though. Hafeez and Sharjeel are out there. Starc wit
Starc to Hafeez, no run full and wide to start, 144.5 kph, left alone nicely. A hint of inward movement
Starc to Hafeez, no run gets that line closer to off, 145 kph, Hafeez gets forward and blocks to mid-off
Starc to Hafeez, no run 146 kph, full and wide from Starc. Seeing if there is some swing, there is but not much. Hafeez misses his leaden-footed drive

Starc to Hafeez, no run edged and dropped! Smith's slips struggles continue. A sitter. Uh oh. Full and wide again, Hafeez goes hard at the ball and gets a thick outside edge which goes straight to Smith at second slip. Gets his hands down near his midriff and shells a dolly. He has dropped an unusual number of catches recently
Starc to Hafeez, no run defended solidly into the cover region

Starc to Hafeez, no run 147 kph, fantastic over from Starc. Attacks the stumps with a full length, Hafeez defends back to the bowler. Starc picks up and is ready to breathe fire but doesn't let go of the ball
Hazlewood to Sharjeel, no run short and wide, there for the cut. Sharjeel just misses it. No worries. If it's there, try. Beaten by bounce
Hazlewood to Sharjeel, no run oh my. That's a gem. Good length outside off, climbs and climbs and climbs past the outside edge. Wade takes it by his head. Cut that!

Hazlewood to Sharjeel, no run 130 kph, the line and length that had Sharjeel nicking off in the Sydney Test. Not wide, not close to off. A set of stumps wide. Sharjeel think, should I cut? Ah, no. Left alone
Hazlewood to Sharjeel, no run close to off on a good length, defended back
Hazlewood to Sharjeel, 1 run there is that backward square leg region in play. Ready to pull anything short, this isn't quite short but he swats anyway to deep backward square leg.
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run on the pads, drifting down. An appeal is quickly aborted. Hafeez misses a flick
Starc to Sharjeel, no run 147 kph, full and straight, Sharjeel gets a thick outside edge which flies towards point.
Starc to Sharjeel, no run 143 kph, full delivery outside off, defended to mid-off. Not much movement
Starc to Sharjeel, 1 wide strays down leg for an extra. 148 kph.

Starc to Sharjeel, FOUR runs shot! A tad too full from Starc, Sharjeel leans forward, a nice gentle stride. His shot is not gentle. Lovely, clean, flowing drive past Warner at mid-off and through cover. Timing
Starc to Sharjeel, 2 runs short and wide this time, cuts in front of extra cover for a couple more. Good batting, there to be hit, hit it
Starc to Sharjeel, no run another clean drive but he finds mid-off. Good batting, depending on timing. Picking the right balls too
Starc to Sharjeel, no run 149 kph, pacey stuff. Beats Sharjeel for pace, he inside-edges his flick into his pad.
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 2 runs 131 kph, on the pads, flicked down towards backward square leg for a couple more
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run close to off on a full length, defended towards point
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 1 wide on a length outside off, too wide. Called
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run a big appeal. No says the umpire. Sliding down. Full and down leg, Hafeez falls over as he misses a flick.
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 1 run another edge. Flies down to third man along the ground, just one. Great fielding from Cummins, sprints to his left to save three
Hazlewood to Sharjeel, FOUR runs races away. Again, so strong on the pull. Slightly short and Sharjeel nails his pull through midwicket for four. Picked the length early
Hazlewood to Sharjeel, no run 134 kph, on a length on leg, defended with a straight bat
Starc to Hafeez, no run full and straight from Starc, worked towards midwicket. That little bit of swing seems to have ceased
Starc to Hafeez, no run angled across, lovely line. A set of stumps outside off. Hafeez plays a good stroke, left alone
Starc to Hafeez, no run another nice leave. Full and wide, asking Hafeez to drive or test Smith again. Hafeez wants neither
Starc to Hafeez, no run 146 kph, dabbed towards backward point
Starc to Hafeez, 1 wide full and way too wide, 148 kph, another leave
Starc to Hafeez, 3 runs too straight from Starc, flicked through square leg for more runs. Three of them
Starc to Sharjeel, no run good end. 149 kph, full and straight, Sharjeel defends back with the full face
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run Hafeez falls over again. Straying down leg, Hafeez misses a flick. Sliding down
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run falls over again! On a length and straight, Hafeez fails to connect with a nudge into the leg side. The ball hits him high on the body
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run good length outside off, Hafeez leaves this alone
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run lovely line. Around off, Hafeez defends into the off side
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run 135 kph, left alone outside off, lovely bowling. Hafeez refuses to play there. Good from both
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run maiden! Hafeez gets forward and drives through cover.
Cummins to Sharjeel, FOUR runs too straight from Cummins first up, Sharjeel tucks away merrily down to the fine leg boundary. Easy as
Cummins to Sharjeel, no run Sharjeel can't get on top of the bounce and play into the leg side. Struck on the body
Cummins to Sharjeel, no run beauty! 143 kph, outside off, Sharjeel is beaten on the outside edge
Cummins to Sharjeel, no run full and straight, defended towards cover
Cummins to Sharjeel, no run full and straight, another solid defensive block
Cummins to Sharjeel, no run 140 kph, shortish delivery on middle, Sharjeel can't time his pull. Hits straight to mid-on
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run full and straight, a solid block
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 2 runs too straight from Hazelwood, flicked down to fine leg, Starc dives to his right and saves some runs. Good stuff
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run on a length outside off, left alone by Hafeez
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run full and straight, seaming back in, attacking the stumps. Hafeez defends into the leg side
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 1 run back of a length on leg, bouncer. Hafeez gloves one down to fine leg. Not in control of the pull, beaten for pace

Hazlewood to Sharjeel, FOUR runs full and straight, Sharjeel picks it up and drag-flicks the ball over midwicket. Closed the bat face but picked his area. Not a bad shot at all. Good proactive batting
Cummins to Hafeez, no run back of a length outside off, Hafeez tries to ride the bounce but lets this one go
Cummins to Hafeez, no run nice channels. A couple of stumps outside off, Hafeez leaves again
Cummins to Hafeez, no run full and straight, defended back
Cummins to Hafeez, no run hustled for pace. Back of a length down leg, Hafeez doesn't connect with his half-pull help down to fine leg. Rapped on the body
Cummins to Hafeez, no run good length outside off, defended into the off side
Cummins to Hafeez, no run another maiden played by Hafeez. Full and straight from Cummins, Hafeez defends back
Faulkner to Sharjeel, no run 126 kph, full delivery outside off, played to the left of short third man. A long run there but Hafeez sends him back. Not good that from Hafeez
Faulkner to Sharjeel, 1 leg bye much better. On a full length down leg, Sharjeel is struck on the pad, hits the pad and ricochets towards point. Hafeez calls Sharjeel through
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run 131 kph, angled across outside off, left alone
Faulkner to Hafeez, 2 runs just clears mid-on. Looks to go over the top, but fails to time the ball after a forward shimmy. Gets enough on that
Faulkner to Hafeez, 1 run too straight and tucked down to fine leg for one. A lot better way to bat, finds the singles
Faulkner to Sharjeel, 1 run shovelled down to deep backward square leg for one.

Cummins to Sharjeel, 1 run full and straight from Cummins, Sharjeel gets a thick inside edge towards deep backward square leg. The pair want two but are just too slow between the wickets. Should have been two there

Cummins to Hafeez, FOUR runs top-edged for four. Bouncer on off, Hafeez fails to control the stroke. Hustles Hafeez, who gets a thick edge which flies down to the fine leg boundary. Grazed the helmet too
Cummins to Hafeez, no run around off on a length, defended
Cummins to Hafeez, no run good length outside off, defended into the off side
Cummins to Hafeez, no run nice lines. Close to off on a length, defended back. Not much Hafeez can do to that
Cummins to Hafeez, no run nice end. But too many dot balls to Hafeez. Good length outside off, played into the off side
Faulkner to Sharjeel, 3 runs lovely shot. Full outside off, Sharjeel gets forward and lofts the ball nonchalantly over cover for three. Didn't bother keeping it down. Nice
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run full and straight, Hafeez gets forward and defends, inside-edges the ball into his pad
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run good length outside off, played towards point. Another dot. Not even looking for one
Faulkner to Hafeez, 1 run gets a leg side delivery that he tucks down to fine leg for a run
Faulkner to Sharjeel, 2 runs fantastic batting. A slower ball down leg, Sharjeel clips him towards deep midwicket and calls for two. Played that with soft hands
Faulkner to Sharjeel, no run shortish delivery, seaming back in, cut towards point
Cummins to Hafeez, no run full delivery outside off, pushed towards cover from the crease
Cummins to Hafeez, no run good length outside off, 142 kph, scythed away towards point where Maxwell dives to his right

Cummins to Hafeez, 2 runs just wide of Wade. Gloved again! A back of a length down leg, Hafeez is late on the pull, flies down towards fine leg. Hazlewood saves two with a dive. Wade is not too far away, diving to his left
Cummins to Hafeez, no run defended towards cover from the crease
Cummins to Hafeez, FOUR runs nailed that! Back of a length on middle and leg, a bouncer. Hafeez thwacks this through deep backward square leg with ease. Placed well too
Cummins to Hafeez, no run fullish on off, 147 kph, pushed towards mid-off
Head to Sharjeel, 1 run shortish outside off, punched down to long-on with so much ease
Head to Hafeez, no run beaten on the outside edge. Flat delivery outside off, skids on with the arm and beats the bat. No turn
Head to Hafeez, FOUR runs nicely played. Gets low and hammers his sweep through deep backward square leg. Fantastic timing. Superb placement
Head to Hafeez, 1 run that's tripe. Short and way down leg, Hafeez pulls down to fine leg. Could have left that and got the extra ball
Head to Sharjeel, 1 run tossed up on leg, clipped through square leg
Head to Hafeez, FOUR runs four more! Great batting, Hafeez runs down to the pitch and drills the ball over the bowler for four. Fantastic timing. Good area to hit the ball too
Faulkner to Sharjeel, 1 run too straight from Faulkner, flicked down to fine leg for one
Faulkner to Hafeez, 3 runs more runs. Full and straight, easy pickings for Hafeez to flick through midwicket for plenty. A poor ball

Faulkner to Sharjeel, OUT taken this time! And Australia get Sharjeel. A length delivery outside off, fourth-stump channel. Sharjeel lets the ball come to him, looking for one down to third man off the open face but the ball kisses the outside edge and is easily held by Wade. Sharjeel looking for something too cheeky, that's not his strength.
Faulkner to Babar Azam, no run good length delivery outside off, pushed towards cover
Faulkner to Babar Azam, no run good stuff. Lovely length, fuller than a good length, Azam is beaten on the inside edge and struck on the pad
Faulkner to Babar Azam, no run too straight from Faulkner, worked away to square leg
Marsh to Hafeez, 1 run good length delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man for a run
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run good length outside off, played down to cover
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run 132 kph, blocked from the crease
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run full and straight, pushed back to the bowler from the crease
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run fullish delivery outside off, pushed away towards mid-off. Seven dot balls from Azam
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run another defensive prod into the off side
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run good length delivery outside off, Hafeez gets forward and lets it go
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run full and very wide, 131 kph, no stroke offered from Hafeez
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run good length outside off, 128 kph, punched towards extra cover
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run full and straight from Faulkner, a solid block
Faulkner to Hafeez, FOUR runs swatted away through midwicket. Full and wide from Faulkner, Hafeez doesn't care. A cross-batted heave into the gap off the front foot. Nowhere near a bad bal
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run full and wide, left alone
Marsh to Babar Azam, 1 run good length outside off, slashed down to third man for one
Marsh to Hafeez, no run some extra bounce. Good length delivery outside off, prodded away towards point. Takes the glove and handle of the bat. Signs of variable bounce
Marsh to Hafeez, 3 runs good length delivery outside off, carved behind point for three. Good batting from Hafeez
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off

Marsh to Babar Azam, FOUR runs superb shot from Azam. Overpitched from marsh and straight, Azam gets forward and crisply caresses his drive through mid-on. Fantastic timing. Full face of the bat, delectable
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run on a length outside off, defended
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run full and straight from Hazlewood, played towards mid-on
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 1 run short and wide, slashed to third man on the bounce, went up and over, wanted that over point
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run fullish delivery outside off, defended into the off side
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run full delivery outside off, defended towards cover
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run fullish length outside off, blocked
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run inside-edged. Full on a fourth-stump line, Azam gets forward and gets a thick edge into his body
Marsh to Hafeez, no run superb lines. Straight on a good length, defended
Marsh to Hafeez, no run 127 kph, good length delivery outside off, dabbed towards backward point
Marsh to Hafeez, no run 128 kph, gets on top of the bounce to steer towards gully. Wants one does Hafeez, rightly sent back

Marsh to Hafeez, 1 leg bye pinged on the helmet. Hafeez has worn some this innings, second time on the helmet. Marsh's back of a length delivery climbs steeply and misses Hafeez's pull. One down to third man
Marsh to Babar Azam, no run pushed towards mid-on
Marsh to Babar Azam, 3 runs too straight this time, flicked through square leg for three more. Made easily, shrewd field manipulation. Waited for the bowler to come to him
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run fullish delivery around off, blocked into the off side
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run good length outside off, steered to point from the crease. Squirted off the outside half
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run a tad too full from Hazlewood, pushed back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run bouncer on off, Azam gets underneath that
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run excellent lines, Hazlewood's forte. Good length on middle, blocked
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run played back towards the bowler. A maiden
Cummins to Hafeez, no run a tad full outside off, driven to mid-off
Cummins to Hafeez, no run good length, zoning in on off. Steered to point
Cummins to Hafeez, no run youch! Another one that flies at Hafeez. Back of a length, climbs steeply and hits the shoulder of the bat, deflects into hos chest. More pain. Soldiers on
Cummins to Hafeez, no run defended towards point, wants one does Hafeez, Azam sends him back
Cummins to Hafeez, 1 run carved down to third man for a run
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run good length outside off, 137 kph, Azam looks to force this through cover but mis-times his slap back to the bowler
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run superb from Faulkner. Full and straight, on-driven elegantly towards mid-on where Faulkner dives to his left
Hazlewood to Hafeez, no run superb lines, close to off on a full length, another solid block
Hazlewood to Hafeez, 1 run 135 kph, fullish length on middle and leg, a soft-hands push towards mid-on for a quick single.

Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run 136 kph, there's the pressure telling. On a length on off, Azam wants to pull, but the ball is nowhere near a pull-able length. Inside-edge into the box, ricochets towards point but bounces in front
Hazlewood to Babar Azam, no run pushed out to mid-on

Hazlewood to Babar Azam, FOUR runs shot! Superb timing from Azam. Gets one on his pads and flicks away through midwicket. Fantastic timing. Gets the bowler to bowl to him, a very un-Hazlewood type delivery
Cummins to Hafeez, 1 run good length outside off, outside-halved down to third man
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run not quite timed. Fullish on off, Azam looks to unfurl a gorgeous drive through mid-off but squirts to mid-on in rather ugly fashion
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run 141 kph, a half-volley outside off, driven to mid-off
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run good length outside off, carved to point from the crease
Cummins to Babar Azam, 2 runs gets it through this time, Warner hunts it down from mid-off but they get just two. Cummins took some pace off that straight drive
Cummins to Babar Azam, 2 runs too straight, flicked away through square leg
Starc to Hafeez, no run a good length delivery outside off, played down towards point
Starc to Hafeez, FOUR runs superb stroke. Full on the pads, Hafeez flicks that nonchalantly over square leg. A wristy flick. Didn't bother keeping that down. Hafeez brings up fifty too
Starc to Hafeez, no run a yorker outside off, carved towards a short third man
Starc to Hafeez, no run both watching each other from the middle of the pitch almost. Full delivery outside off, pushed into the cover region
Starc to Hafeez, no run on a length outside off, blocked
Starc to Hafeez, no run past the edge this time. Full and wide from Starc, Hafeez is rooted in the crease, pushes and the ball goes past his bat
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run 141 kph, outside off from Cummins, driven to mid-off
Cummins to Babar Azam, no run 141 kph, driven to cover from the crease
Cummins to Babar Azam, 1 run good single. 140 kph, outside off and full, Azam opens the bat face late to get one to third man
Cummins to Hafeez, no run 144 kph, a full length outside off, draws Hafeez forward who drives to mid-off
Cummins to Hafeez, 3 runs too straight again. Hafeez is so strong there. Whipped through square leg for another three runs. Uppish but wide of the fielder
Cummins to Babar Azam, FOUR runs shot! Good length on off, Azam reads the length early, goes on the back foot and hammers his pull over midwicket. Fantastic execution
Starc to Hafeez, 1 run if you can make a run to Warner look easy, it's well judged. Full outside off, pushed to mid-off, Hafeez calls immediately and gets there
Starc to Babar Azam, no run offcutter on off, blocked
Starc to Babar Azam, no run saved four. Wow. Full and wide from Starc, Azam laces his drive towards extra cover. Head sticks out a left hand and prevents plenty of runs. Fantastic stuff
Starc to Babar Azam, 1 run full outside off, moving away late. A thick outside edge races down to third man for one
Starc to Hafeez, no run 144 kph, full and straight, pushed to mid-off
Starc to Hafeez, no run 150 kph. Full and wide, Hafeez misses his dab down to third man. Pakistan 1 for 111
Faulkner to Babar Azam, no run good length on off and middle, pushed away towards mid-off
Faulkner to Babar Azam, 1 leg bye on the hips, Azam misses a nudge, struck on the pad and a deflection to fine leg ensues

Faulkner to Hafeez, 2 runs dropped! Another sensational effort, but just can't cling on. Extra cover was 10 metres outside the circle. Hafeez wanted to go over cover but the ball squirted off the outside half. Cummins stretches out a left hand but the ball bursts out
Faulkner to Hafeez, 1 run dabbed down to third man
Faulkner to Babar Azam, 1 run creamed away. Full and wide, driven to the right of Cummins this time. He's probably at that awkward position to cut off the angles?
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run blocked into the off side, nice and straight from Faulkner
Starc to Babar Azam, no run full delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off
Starc to Babar Azam, 2 runs good length on middle and leg, swatted through square leg for a couple more
Starc to Babar Azam, 1 run nicely steered to third man off the open face. Need more of that

Starc to Hafeez, FOUR runs in the air but in the gap. Four. Full and wide, swerving away. Hafeez can't hold back his drive, ends up skewing the ball off the outside half through point. Very catchable but not to the fielder
Starc to Hafeez, 3 runs more runs, full and straight, a wristy flick over square leg. Didn't want to keep that down. More runs

Starc to Babar Azam, FOUR runs flies down to the third man boundary. Back of a length outside off, Azam gives it all he has, the ball flashes away off the top edge over gully. Think I saw steam from Starc's ears
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run slower ball outside off, defended towards mid-off
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run slower ball outside off, Hafeez fails to connect with a guide
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run 119 kph, slower ball, carved to backward point, Maxwell is quick to the ball
Faulkner to Hafeez, no run goes past the outside edge. Full and wide outside off, Hafeez pokes and the ball swerves past
Faulkner to Hafeez, 1 run 123 kph, good length outside off, played down to third man for one
Faulkner to Babar Azam, FOUR runs superlative timing. Full and wide from Faulkner, Azam times his cover drive past cover. No chance once he found the gap. Awesome stuff
Starc to Hafeez, FOUR runs through the gap again. Full and wide from Starc, Hafeez leans forward and scythes a drive through point. These two letting loose now
Starc to Hafeez, 1 run back of a length outside off, Hafeez gets a thick outside edge which flies down to third man, on the bounce

Starc to Babar Azam, OUT taken! Not a percentage stroke with third man in place. Back of a length outside off, Azam plays that nicely, sways away from the line, arches his back and gets underneath the ball. Ramps the ball but can't get it over slip, more over gully, and because of that, third man is able to get around and complete a good catch at the third man boundary. May have been a b
Starc to Shafiq, no run a yorker outside off, jammed out
Starc to Shafiq, no run another yorker outside off, kept out again
Starc to Shafiq, no run full and wide, left alone
Faulkner to Hafeez, 1 run fuller ball on off, presses forward and opens his bat face to run it down towards third man
Faulkner to Shafiq, no run late away movement outside off. It's very full and Shafiq gets beaten as he tries to squeeze it out through the off side
Faulkner to Shafiq, no run short of a length and on the stumps, stays back and defends but gets an inside edge to the pads
Faulkner to Shafiq, 1 run back of a length and angling away outside off, waits for it to come before opening the bat face late to steer it down to third man
Faulkner to Malik, no run fuller back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, presses forward and drives into the off side
Starc to Shafiq, no run poor shot. Full and wide, Shafiq doesn't go after that properly, nor does he bail out. Ends up poking, the ball goes past

Starc to Shafiq, 1 run Warner's done something to his hamstring? Full and wide, driven towards Warner at mid-off, who runs to the ball, got into position to throw at the batsman's end, but just pulled up, Looks fine though
Starc to Malik, no run lovely bowling. Full and wide, Malik drives but Starc gets late away movement. Beats the bat
Starc to Malik, no run fullish delivery outside off, defended towards extra cover
Starc to Malik, no run nice again, full and straight, Malik defends

Starc to Malik, 3 leg byes too straight, off the pads down to fine leg. Malik was hesitant but came back for the second. The throw was not accurate, the backing-up not great and Pakistan get three eventually. Would have been very close had the stumps been hit at the batsman's end
Cummins to Malik, no run good length on off, 138 kph, the ball seams back in and hits the inside edge of Malik, onto the body
Cummins to Malik, no run nice line. Around off, coming back in. Malik defends

Cummins to Malik, FOUR runs edged and short of first slip. Goes through the fielder for four. Fullish length outside off, Malik gets a genuine outside edge which dies in front of Marsh. Goes through his hands for four
Cummins to Malik, 1 run another edge, this time along the ground, for one to third man
Cummins to Shafiq, no run full outside off, defended
Cummins to Shafiq, no run full and straight, flicked away to midwicket. Good over from Cummins
Hazlewood to Malik, no run full delivery outside off, Malik defends to point
Hazlewood to Malik, no run full and straight, pushed back
Hazlewood to Malik, no run on the pads, 132 kph, pushed with the angle to mid-on. Another dot. These dots are more than just dots though, it's pressure, it's momentum
Hazlewood to Malik, no run lovely line. Getting the ball to seam back in, attacking the pads. Malik's defensive technique intervenes
Hazlewood to Malik, 1 run on a length and straight, defended
Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run
Cummins to Malik, FOUR runs shortish and wide, Malik gets on top of the bounce and laces a square drive through point. Forced that through.
Cummins to Malik, no run good length outside off, defended into the off side
Cummins to Malik, 1 wide 139 kph, loopy bouncer over the head, wide called

Cummins to Malik, no run beauty! Exceptional bowling. Malik reviews the out decision. A big noise, was it bat on pad, or bat on ball? Hotspot has nothing. This is interesting. There is a big spike before the ball reaches the bat, which may indicate that the bat clipped the pad. But that doesn't mean there is no bat on ball. In this case, it was just bat on pad. The back flap was moved fo
Cummins to Malik, 2 runs sweet timing through cover for a couple more. Just a gentle push, leans into the drive
Cummins to Malik, no run a bouncer, a high bouncer, 143 kph. Second bouncer called. Not wide
Cummins to Malik, no run on the pads, worked to square leg
Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run full and straight, some seam movement back in, pushed to mid-on with the angle
Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run just short of midwicket. No need for these strokes. Back of a length on middle, Shafiq mis-times his pull and is lucky that the ball lands in front of Khawaja
Hazlewood to Shafiq, 1 run calls for one. Gets there. A bit of a leading edge to mid-off. Warner is quick to it and fires an inaccurate throw to the batsman's end. Out with a direct hit

Hazlewood to Malik, SIX runs oh yea. What a shot. Full and straight and speaking about percentage strokes, how's this? Presents the full face of the bat and lofts over mid-on. Clean ball-striking. Clears the boundary. Experience.
Hazlewood to Malik, no run defended into the off side
Hazlewood to Malik, no run good length delivery outside off, blocked to cover

Cummins to Malik, no run big appeal, not out. Smith reviews. Has nothing to lose. Good length on middle and leg, seaming back in. Strikes Malik over the kneeroll. No bat. Looks a touch high. Two reds, but one very important green as the ball is heading over leg stump. An easy decision that on this surface.
Cummins to Malik, no run good length outside off, some inward seam movement. Malik is beaten on the inside edge
Cummins to Malik, 2 runs too straight, nudged away to deep backward square leg for a couple more. Already can see what Pakistan missed in the previous game, some experience
Cummins to Malik, 1 run inside-edged just past the stumps. A leaden-footed slap, one to fine leg
Cummins to Shafiq, 3 runs through square leg for a couple more. Full and straight from Cummins, Shafiq skews a couple towards fine leg

Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run full and straight, a thick inside edge into the pad? No, says umpire Wilson. Big big appeal. No inside edge. Hit both pads. Sliding down? Umpire's call on impact with stumps
Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run nice channel around off, defended
Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run 132 kph, length on middle, inside-edged into the pad. Malik sends an exuberant Shafiq back. No run there
Hazlewood to Shafiq, no run 132 kph, fullish outside off, another solid defensive block
Hazlewood to Shafiq, 1 run a thick outside edge down to third man for one
Hazlewood to Malik, 1 run nice. A steer down to third man
Marsh to Malik, FOUR runs tripe to start. Short and wide, Malik gets under the bounce and scythes over point. Exceptionally played. Didn't bother keeping it down
Marsh to Malik, no run full and straight, blocked
Marsh to Malik, no run full and straight again, driven back to Marsh
Marsh to Malik, no run good length on off, Malik stays in the crease and plays it down. Well played

Marsh to Malik, FOUR runs shot. Superb. The MCG goes wild. Full and straight from Marsh, Malik presents the full face to on-drive through mid-on. Making run-scoring look so easy on a difficult surface
Marsh to Malik, no run knows he got eight off it, so he gets forward and blocks this full delivery
Starc to Shafiq, 1 run back of a length down leg, nudged down to fine leg
Starc to Malik, no run full delivery on leg, blocked to mid-on
Starc to Malik, 1 run another good single. On middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for a quick run
Starc to Shafiq, 2 runs nice shot. Warner parries it away. Full outside off, a nice clean drive towards mid-off. Shafiq gets forward and drives to mid-off. Warner dives to his right and saves two
Starc to Shafiq, no run full and wide, 143 kph, left alone
Starc to Shafiq, no run yorker outside off, jammed back
Marsh to Malik, 1 run good length outside off, caressed down to third man off the open face
Marsh to Shafiq, no run deflected towards square leg
Marsh to Shafiq, 1 run too straight, picked off his hips for a run to fine leg
Marsh to Malik, 1 wide bouncer, Malik gets underneath, but it's too high. The illegal delivery is duly punished
Marsh to Malik, no run good length outside off, Malik misses a cut.
Marsh to Malik, no run blocked to mid-off from the front foot
Marsh to Malik, 1 wide strays down leg for leg side wide. Lots of extras now
Marsh to Malik, no run blocked off the front foot

Starc to Shafiq, 1 run driven to mid-on for a quick single. A direct hit at the bowler's end forces the intervention of the third umpire, but Shafiq has made his ground with time to spare. Well-judged. Hazlewood at mid-on
Starc to Malik, no run full and straight, blocked. Good batting. Play out Starc
Starc to Malik, 2 runs 145 kph, gets this through extra cover for a couple. Half-stopped by extra cover, diving to his left
Starc to Malik, 1 run Warner dives to his right, saves three and almost effects a wicket. But Malik has made the run, pushed off the front foot to mid-off

Starc to Shafiq, OUT that's Shafiq gone. Extremely poor shot. Full and wide from Starc, the ball was moving away. He had o reason to play with this being Starc's last over. Shafiq, though, wanted to drive through cover. Ended up stretching out for the ball, but it was too wide. Had no control, no balance and got a thick outside edge to Wade
Starc to Umar Akmal, no run just misses the outside edge. Full outside off, the ball pitches and moves away to beat the bat
Marsh to Malik, 1 run 120 kph, good length on middle and leg, worked to square leg
Marsh to Umar Akmal, no run 125 kph, pushed to mid-on from the crease
Marsh to Umar Akmal, 3 runs crashed through point. Good length and wide outside off, Akmal carved a guided square punch to the left of cover point. Takes the pace off with a dive does Cummins
Marsh to Malik, no run full outside off, crisply driven to mid-off
Marsh to Malik, FOUR runs hammered! A fraction short is Marsh and Malik pounces all over it. Gets his cross-bat in position early and swats over midwicket. Timing is great too
Marsh to Malik, no run full and straight, pushed to mid-on
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run 123 kph, full around off, defended
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run full delivery outside off, blocked into the off side
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run full and straight, another solid defensive block
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs lofts this for four. Full outside off, saw the length he wanted, got underneath and a clean full-face lofted drive over the bowler's head
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, 1 run full and wide outside off, drilled towards Warner at mid-off, who dives to his left to save three
Faulkner to Malik, no run defended into the off side, another over ticks by
Head to Umar Akmal, no run slow on off, Akmal gets forward to defend
Head to Umar Akmal, no run 91 kph, driven towards cover
Head to Umar Akmal, no run tries to shimmy down but the length is shorter, Akmal pushes back, Head dives to his right
Head to Umar Akmal, no run short on off, worked to midwicket
Head to Umar Akmal, 1 run flat on the pads, worked to deep midwicket

Head to Malik, 2 runs shortish on middle, Malik was sitting back in the crease, knowing there was no flight. Pulled past midwicket for some runs. Warner dives to his left but can't cut the ball back in
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run good length outside off, Akmal misses a cut, beaten for bounce
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, no run good length outside off, pushed to cover
Faulkner to Umar Akmal, 1 run a wild swing. Full on off, Akmal looks to smash this over midwicket, a thick inside edge towards leg gully
Faulkner to Malik, no run hit on the body. 127 kph, length delivery on middle. Malik hit on the back thigh
Faulkner to Malik, no run comes down but the length is good and Malik has to improvise a block
Faulkner to Malik, no run defended from the crease, tidy over from Faulkner
Head to Umar Akmal, no run flat on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Head to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs gets down to the pitch and lofts over cover for four. Nice use of the feet to get close to the pitch. Good execution
Head to Umar Akmal, no run blocked from the crease
Head to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs Akmal comes down and hammers a drive past his partner. Whistles past mid-off for four. Scores are level
Head to Umar Akmal, 1 wide the game finishes with a wide. Head fires this down leg and Pakistan complete a sensational win by six wickets at the MCG
Time for the presentation

10.17pm Pakistan completely outplayed Australia today, absolutely no doubt about that. It began by tying down Australia with spin. Changes in pace, cutters, pace off, change-ups. Australia could only manage 220. Pakistan knew what they were doing all along in that chase. Took their time and put the odd ball away. That's all they needed. A clinical bowling performance followed with a clean, effi
Pakistan won by 6 wickets (with 14 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Mohammad Hafeez, PAK
